parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From a compound of a and stoichos; to miss the mark, i.e. deviate from truth.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
